Yeah I never understood that either. Granted a pit bull has more chance to do damage if it attacks. But a well trained pit bull is as likely to attack as a well trained any other dog. The problem is that many pit bulls are not trained properly, because people get them for the "image" they provide.

Also the only I dog I ever considered attacking was a little ball of fur that was picking at my heel one night I was at a park with a few friends just hanging out. I was considering punting that little fucker into the river.

Yeah...no. We face a future which is not easy, we have to fix stuff you guys fucked up, because you didn't seem to care about the future. So no, we don't have it easier but for the most part it's harder for us.

I myself smoke not but my dad quit smoking 2 years ago after I think nearly 40 years of smoking. For him vaping helped a lot. How can I help you? And I mean it, if you have questions, just ask them and I'll answer them to my best knowledge. Though I don't know Swift so I can't give examples in that directly.
You are welcome. Alas Math.random() does not really produce good random numbers, so if you need good random numbers you should consider other sources (e.g. /dev/urandom on most Linux systems).

Your solution is slower though. With the "ugly" way you only have one call to Math.random() and Math.floor() and not one for every digit. Also the solution with the loop takes up more memory because it keeps the number two times in it, once as the array the second time then as a string/integer.
I know in this case it does not matter, but it may matter on a larger scale though.

I wouldn't be so sure about the "way" more money. From my experience Dota 2 players spend more money on the game than LoL players. Not saying that Dota 2 makes more, but this "way" I'm not sure about. Just remember that through the compendium stuff this year they made close to $80 Million alone.

LoL profits dwarf DOTA 2's profits. Im not sure of the exact numbers at the moment. It was like 20 times or something crazy. There's an easy to find link...the two games by the numbers.
Then would you be so kindly to provide the link? I don't make that claim and it's not my resposibility to prove it. I'm not saying that LoL does not make more money but the dimension seems a bit odd at least. Either the numbers are old or skewered.
This prize pool is jacked up by Valve to get some hype going, DOTA 2 wants a bigger cut of the MOBA pie that League is hogging right now.
What? The prizepool started at 1.6 Million USD and the rest of the over 18 Million USD was provided by the community. If you think Valve provided some if it. I don't know but I don't believe it. Why would they? Honestly I don't think that a big prizepool alone is generating hype at least not for me or the people I know.
DOTA 2 wants a bigger cut of the MOBA pie that League is hogging right now.
That I agree Valve wants a bigger share, but I don't know if they would spend so much on it if it's not generating revenue for them.
I mean the games are really similar
Eh only if one does not look to close. If you spend a bit of time in both you will see the differences and how huge the impact on the games are. I'm not saying either is better, but they are different enough that they do to a degree cater to different people.
DOTA 2 and LoL are both great, and I feel Leagues biggest advantage is its head start.
Yes, the head start is actually really big part. I don't know which game would be ahead if they started at the same time. And yes both games are great.
I don't know, but it was way to abrupt. It was basicly just "How do you feel?" "Good!" "Super, kthxbye here is some random non related music act with a way to slow song to take away all the hype."

I agree with you, but there may be people who wouldn't have liked that. They just should've let EG celebrate a bit on the stage with a bit of background music then after a bit traverse to the closing ceremony. It was way to abrupt the way they now did it.

The problem is there is not one music or artist everybody likes, but that is not even the problem for me. The problem for me right now is that they took away the focus from EG from the games that just ended and all of the hype that came with it.
Also hate to say it but he looks like he is havin a seizure or smth like that behind that booth.

I would wager that one of the main factors is the money that Valve makes with Dota 2. It feels for me that Valve sees more money to be gained in Dota 2 than in CS:GO so that may be one of the biggest reasons.
Alas we don't have keys anymore in Dota 2. The chests/crates can be bought in the Dota 2 store and are unlocked right away, also you are guaranteed 1 set/item out of a chest and if buy a second chest you are guaranteed to not get the same one a second time.
I would really like to know which game does generate the more profit. Not only because they are competing but also because of to see what model is more profitable, because they are quite different.

I think it stems from the way they are competetive and free more or less (the less stems from the way LoL handles the heroes/champions which in my opinion is not really free). You only have to invest money in the games to be able to play them and get good. At least that would be my guess.

Hey,
ich versuche deine Fragen nach bestem Wissen und Gewissen zu beantworten, aber nimm nicht alles als 100% wahr hin. Es entspricht nur meinen Erfahrungen.
1. Ich habe leider nicht den richtigen Arzt gefunden, aber es ist vollkommen okay erstmal bei mehreren vorzusprechen um den (oder die) Richtige zu finden. Generell wird jeder Psychiater und auch Psychologe die ersten 2 oder 3 Sitzungen machen ehe er eine entsprechende Therapie bei deiner KK beantragt. 2. Zum einem habe ich im Internet gesucht zum anderem aber auch meinen Hausarzt gefragt ob er da Informationen oder Kontakte hat. Frs Internet empfehle ich die Seite der KKV aus deiner Region. 3. Es gibt keine allgemeinen Kriterien. Mach Termine und schau wie du dich bei dem Arzt fhlst. Es ist wichtig, dass du dich wohl fhlst. 4. Psychologen gehren wohl zu den rzten die mit am meisten Termine haben, daher haben sie nicht so viel Zeit fr Sprechzeiten oder Anrufe. Die Meisten bei denen ich versucht habe, hatten tagsber nur einen Anrufbeantworter auf den man gesprochen hat und dann wurde man zurck gerufen. Und ja meistens gehen Sie selbst ans Telefon. 5. Mir persnlich ist es egal, aber wie gesagt du musst dich wohl fhlen. 6. Such dir einen Arzt bei dem du dich wohl fhlst, das ist meiner Meinung nach das wichtigste. Es geht dabei um dich und der Arzt kann dir nur helfen wenn du dich bei ihm sicher und geborgen fhlst.
P.S. Ich nutze hier oftmals mnnliche Pronomen, das hat einfach den Sinn der Einfachheit sowohl beim Schreiben als auch beim Lesen. Bitte versteht es geschlechtsneutral.

Hehe, yeah. I work as a programmer/support for a smallish hosting company now. And honestly more ofthen than not instead of really knowing the answer I just google for 2mins and can provide them with all the info they need or the second most problem is them not reading the instructions on the screen.

Luckily it's getting to a point where nobody uses IE6 anymore. I think we don't have any visitors with it anymore, which is great, but there are still oldish browser versions running around. Most of the times it's IE but I have also seen old Safari versions.

I think we have kind of a hard "limit" for everything older than IE9. IE9 is the highest version for Vista and I think Vista either is already out of support or at least will be soon. But the worst case we had was one customer after the relaunch our side who used an PowerPC Apple and complained that the site did not fully run with his obsolete Safari Version on an obsolete OS X Version. He wanted to cancel the contract with us because of that.

I've closed tickets with a "can't reproduce" status and a comment saying that I can't reproduce on the system aviable to me and to provide more information about the system used.
Funnily most of them times it came to light that they used a system we did not define as compatible. For example we stated "Does not work with IE older than 9" or somehting like that and people would open tickets about the website not working in IE6 or stuff like that, happens way to often.
There is but to my knowledge most regular LoL players buy the heroes they want to play the most. So they are not completley reliant on the free hero rotation thing.

I'm responsible for the deaths of Africans and Arabs just because I think Germany is the home of German people?
If you refuse a person in disgress help because you want to keep your country "clean" then yes you are responsible for it. Refugees are more often than not not here because they fancy it so or because they like Germany so much and want to live here, but because they are in imminent danger if they stay in their home country. They are human beings and as such they have the human rights. Article 3 of these state:
Everyone has the right to life, liberty and security of person.
So you want to take that right of of them because you feel like this little bit of soil is German and should be the home of German people. Hate to break the news for you, but you have a serious problem if that's really what you think.
f it makes me racist that I think we should be looking for other solutions than stuffing these holes with Turks, Arabs and Africans, whose cultures are in no way related to ours, who don't give 2 shits about our culture and about whose cultures I don't give 2 shits, then yes, I am racist.
Glad you see that you are racist. Honestly though most "Turks, Arabs and Africans" I know are aware of our culture and respect it. They do some things different, but that's okay, because they have the fucking right to do it that way. Once via the human rights and second via our Grundgesetz. Also if you don't give 2 shits about their culture maybe not only they, but also you are "the problem"? Instead of hating the other culture without knowing it without interacting with it how about an open exchange with it? Why not talk with people from other cultures and learn about "their" ways and teach them about "our" ways and "our" culture?
The whole thing is not something simple and no taking them the right to take refugee in our country is no solution and never will be a soltion. If it changes anything it spures up hate from the people in need and honestly in my opinion that leads to more problems all in all.
We are all humans there is not a big difference between "them" and "us". What little difference there is should not matter if there are lives on the stake.
Actually there is a slight difference. "Alot" can happen if by accident as a typo while "PIN Number" and such not really. However I fixed it for you.

I'm from the EU and still up. But honestly the downtime is pretty annoying, because that's when my tiredness starts building up. As long as the game is going it's easy to stay awake at the moment.

WRITING.TITLE: How could I have farmed faster?
WRITING.TEXT:
Just played a game as AM where we lost after 50mins. I went 6:7:1 with the highest GPM and second highest XPM, but it all went to shit, because by the time I was readish to join the fights the enemies were to farmed.
Early I was pressured in lane and even through I had a WW in my lane I couldn't go to last hit. So my BF took a bit to long. I'm just not sure if I should've got another item first so that I could've joined fights earlier or not.
So please advice on how to handle such a lane and how to farm more effective are much appreciated, also pointing out errors I made is also welcome, with a hint/tip how to do better.
Here is the [dotabuff](http://www.dotabuff.com/matches/1683005466) link to the match.
Thank y'all in advance.
Well depending on the mother it may also just to be to see the guy she lets her daughter to a show. It may not really be the decision of the girl.

easier to install than Windows by far
Haha, no just no. I installed many Windows and many Linuxes in the last few years. Many different Distros and at no point was a Linux setup as easy as the Windows pendant. Where the installation of Linux is better is individualizing right from the get go. I don't say the installation process is worse, but not easier. My last Win 8.1 install took about 40mins from the first boot up on DVD. For the most part I wasn't even needed I just sat before the screen and watched. The last Linux I installed was a Suse and while it was not hard or bad, it took longer and it needed to know way more stuff from me, stuff that some users may not know shit about.
Every one can choose what everyone wants. I actually like both systems, but I use Windows for my main PC because I'm a gamer and I play games that are not ported to Linux. I'm not even sure if I would use Linux then, because the difference would not be as big as many people say and I currently do have Windows installed.
All I think we all should stop with the hate. Windows is far from it's bad times and even hardcore Linuxer like my boss say it's decent enough for the most people. And Linux has come a long way to be more user friendly and easier to access. Also there is a place for both OS.

If you can't afford to go away to school, you shouldn't.
Problem with that is that you need to go to school to get a decent job for the most part. Sadly same goes for Germany for the most part. But then again studying in Germany is far cheaper than in the U.S.
Oh and don't misunderstand me the U.S. has many things that are better than in Germany, but the social security is much higher in Germany, which I prefer over earning more.

The US having more debt is simply bad consumer/personal choices, not an indictment of the system.
There I disagree. Just the debt you get/can get from college and university is not funny. Honestly with such a start in the professional life you have a life full of debt before you.
as everyone I know in Germany can't afford to literally buy anything
I disagree there I live in Germany my family is not rich nor really poor, but we can buy all the stuff we need and still have money left.
Also don't forget that I did say that there are bad things about our system, but at least it's not as ruthless against poorer people like the one in the U.S. health care alone is reason enough for me to favor the German systems 99 out of 100 times.

Well I don't pay 50% income tax, because it's tied in how much you make. Also better to have a constant and calculated amount of money you have to pay but get cheaper and more calculateable healthcare costs for it. Oh and don't forget unemployment benefits if you loose your jobs and retirement.
I'm not saying that everything in the German system is fine and dandy, but it's way better than the system in the U.S. which basiclly fucks you over if you loose a job. Oh and don't forget that 2011 [69% of all households in the U.S. had a debt of some kind](https://www.census.gov/people/wealth/files/Debt%20Highlights%202011.pdf), while in [Germany only 47% had debts](https://www.bundesbank.de/Redaktion/DE/Pressemitteilungen/BBK/2013/2013_03_21_phf.html). Sorry for the German in the second PDF but that's the only study I could find.
Well [Heise](http://www.heise.de/newsticker/meldung/GEMA-YouTube-Streit-Deutsche-Nutzer-ohne-Live-Video-von-der-IETF-2265116.html) (in German) said it has to do with GEMA, but it maybe both actually.
It does but I think it's way to slow for livestreams.

IANAL so here is how I understand the problem with it.
We in Germany have something called the GEMA, which centralizes the rights of music artists under itself. If you want to publicy play anything that contains GEMA protected(?) music you have to pay a certain fee. Youtube says the fee of the GEMA is to high, while GEMA wants to apply the normal rate to YouTube. YouTube now blocks everything that may containt music that is protected by the GEMA to prevent them from sueing the shit out of YouTube. Afaik their content id system does this automatically for videos, but for livestreams it does not work. So the easiest solution from their point of view is to just block it completly.
See and I'm not used to temperature cracks, but even though in my opinion who drives with a cracked windshield longer than needed is reckless and deserves every punishment (s)he can't get for it.

Not really an issue where I live so I haven't seen them, but I have seen plenty of cracks because of gravel being thrown up from tires or falling down from trucks.
But still there is enough reason to repair a cracked windshild asap regardless on how small the fucking crack is.

A crack is the result of a single point impact otherwise there would be no crack at all. And I actually sat in a car where it happened and no the vision was not fine and yes if you drive with that on the road and you crash I hope you get sued to shit, because you desevere it.

I don't know about you, but I would not want to drive with a windshield like [this](http://www.centralcontracts.com/news/wp-content/uploads/car-windscreen.jpg) or even [this](http://www.autoglasshamilton.ca/images/windshield-repair-2.jpg). It's not safe, because what I can see is severly hindered. If only you would only endager yourself okay, fine do what ever the fuck you want, but driving a car with a winshield like that is reckless, because you endager all the people with you on the road.
Seriously don't drive with a crack in the windshield. Repair it and everything is dandy. Heck where I live you can get fined if you have a visible crack in your windshield and you don't do anything against it, because of the risk of it spreading and hindering your vision.

Did I say it shatters? No, but still not a good position do be in if it breaks, because at least your vision will be severly limited afterwards. Better not get into that position at all and get you glass fixed if the glass is cracked.
A cracked windshield is not only cosmetics. What if it completly breaks while you are driving fast? Not a good spot to be in.

Are delays and filthy trains the norm?
Yes and no. It all depends on what you say is filthy. I take an RB (regional train) to work everyday. And while it may not be mega super clean and sometimes there are cars with graffity on the outside in general they are clean enough for the pupose.
Delays up to 5 minutes are to be expected. Let's say you train should come at 8:29 it's completly normal that it may come at 8:31 wihtout any information. Longer delays are not that common in my experience but they happen.
In general I always say that the DB is not perfect, but when considering the size of the network they have I think they are pretty good. All in all I think our public transportaion system in Germany is better than in many other countries, even in Europe.

She also said that she just barley didn't cheat on him on multiple occasion don't forget that. There is more than just the sexual attraction that led to this.
No she isn't an angel, nor is she a deamon for ending a relationship before she cheated on the other person. Personaly I think that it takes courage to do so. Because you hurt the person, but you spare them most likely bigger pain.
Yes what she did maybe wasn't optimal, yes she is not an angel, but she is neither is there a reason to shame for it like you did. If she didn't love him anymore, which I think is safe to assume as she feels no remorse over breaking up with him, it's in her and his best interest to end it right there and not keep on dragging it out, which most likely hurts more.
Also your argument about the future is total bullshit. Sure she may have "thrown away" a nice looking future but maybe she got a even better one now? We can't fucking see in the future so there is no reason do dwell upon it in cases like this.

Thanks. I'm kind of okay right now, but 2012-mid 2014 were really rough. I lost three jobs in that time, screwed up my University degree, screwed myself over financially and even had to pay a huge fine. Back then I would eat nothing for days. Just sitting at my PC and sleeping.
Now it's better. I have a steady job that I wish to keep for the next few years at least. I'm actually thinking of stuying part time to get a degree and I have at least one meal a day. Still it's very fragile I know if something bad happens I can loose it all again.

I have anorexia. I currently weight 50kg (110lb) on 172cm (5.6ft). I know I have it the last 5 years now, when I was diagnosed with it. However I would wager that I had it for longer than that. For me the problem is not the eating or that I don't like it, I love a good meal. However I can go days or weeks without eating properly. It's hard to explain, but it's tied into my depression, which I have developed (don't know if that's the right word) shortly after my parents divorced, because I can't really talk about feelings and stuff. I use the not eating kind of as punishment for myself if I mad a mistake e.g. hurt the feelings of a person who is important to me.
It's all rather complicated and I know I should start seein a therapist about it, but it's so freaking hard to break the cycle. I actually started seeing one about a year ago and then didn't go there anymore, because I don't even know why. So yeah.
Holy shit. These were valuable later on. I know a friend of mine sold his for nearly $100.
ICQ and live messenger. I still know my ICQ number

I intend to do at some point, but can't afford it currently. I'm from Germany and the flight alone is quite expensive. I think one flight alone banks around 600EUR if I book 3 months in advance. So 1.2k only for the flights.
I know that there are good things in the U.S. but still I'm glad that I live in a country where we have social security and healthcare and such. Not everything is great, but no country is perfect.

It's not obvious for me. I don't get it at all.
I fooled around with guys a bit and honestly did find it gross or anything just not my kind of style. I also admit openly if I think a guy is good looking.
After your logic I should be gay for life, but all people I have talked to and about that topic just don't care. Maybe I know only very open minded people, I don't know, it's just weird to me.
Also the negative sentiment that seems to occur when you are "gay" never really got around to me. I was called "gay" once or twice and always I just calmy ask them "And what if?" most people don't have an answer for that.

I think it would be the world of "Drachenkaiser" by Markus Heitz a German author and thus a German book.
It playes in a alternative universe after World War I. Dragons are real and secretly rule the world, but are also hunted by "divine" warriors of the Roman Catholic Church and illegal privateers.

2013: Got a tattoo and had a small dinner with my family 2014: Sat alone on my computer being depressed in another city than 2014 after the second move in 2 years 2015: Had my family over and went to dinner with them

Microsleep
I was driving home from bringing my then to-be-girlfriend home. I first had to take an Autobahn and then just ruralish road into one town. The ruralish road goes down a rather steep hill and has a few curves in it. I fell asleep on one of the longer straights and awoke just in time to prevent my car from crashing into an house at one curve. After that I was awake for the last 20 minutes it took me to get home. But holy shit after that I never drove again when sleepy as fuck.
I kind of make plans on how I could kill myself and/or others at most situations I have to do nothing. If you see me idly looking at nothing I'm planing.
The sounds of eating in general are just no, just no. I don't want to hear anybody eat.
Name of my character in a japanese themed Bulletin Board RPG. I now use it for at least a decade so yeah, I just grew used to it I think.

I think the most outrageous was the guy who would not accept that we didn't process a cancelation, that he send on Friday 10 Minutes before weekend, until the next Monday 2 minutes after start of work. Seriously he was calling right at the beginning and threatening legal action and stuff like that. I explained the matter to him FIVE fucking time before I hung up with the approval of my bosses. Naturally he called again, but we have one agent who is kind of the one we let handle hard people and he took the call afterwards.
The most bizarre was the guy with an PowerPC Mac and an ancient version of Safari complaining that our homepage is not working for him after a reboot. At first we were all like "the fuck is happening" trying to find the error, but when asked what he used as a browser we were just dumbfolded at his answer. We even gave him links to backports of the newest Firefox version so he has a modern and more secure browser, but nah 20mb or whatever the download was, was to big for him. He threatened cancellation but never followed through to my knowledge.

The thing is cats learn how to hunt from their mother while playing, that's why their play is often pretty close to hunting and why younger cats sometimes go over the edge. But when the cat knows hot to hunt it also knows what is play and what not. They don't hunt the owner because they wanna kill them, but because he is playing with them.

Well Number 4 is how it should be. Like my father says "Du entschuldigst dich nicht, sondern bittest um Entschuldigung" which would translate roughly to "You don't apologize but ask for pardon" or something like that. It means that the person you are apoligizing to has no obligation to accept it.
Also in German you normally have to say "Ich bitte um Entschuldigung" the short form "Entschuldigung" or it various forms are just that a short form, they still mean that you asks for the party involved to accept your apology. It's not that common nowadays that the person does not accept it, but it may happen.

I don't know the excat weight, but the rims are aluminum not carbon fibre. The front rims are 10 x 15 in the back rims 14 x 15 in. The tire are Firestone Firehawks. I would guess, that they are slightly lighter than consumer wheels, but not super light weight at all.
I know for a fact that there where accidents where people where hit by flying Formular 1 tires and died. I would assume simmilar accidents happened at the Indy races. Thus they use this kind of saftey harness to prevent the tire from flying around.

The wheels are probably super lightweight compared to consumers stuff.
No, they are quite heavy as far as I know.
Could be a brake cable.
Again no, that is most likely a saftey cable to keep the wheel attached to the car so it doesn't go flying around and maybe hitting people, which in most cases is fatal. I know for a fact that the Formula 1 has something like that so I assume that Indy and other races have something like that too. It's just to dangerous to have a wheel go flying around.
